comment.author: 31419719@N00
comment._content: Stalheim Hotel and Nærøydalen. The hotel is still there: www.stalheim.com/

comment.author: 20119204@N07
comment._content: This valley ("-dalen") is by the Sognefjord, not Hardangerfjord. The view is Nærøydalen (old spelling: Nærødalen) looking from the county of Hordaland into the county of Sogn & Fjordane. Together with famous Nærøyfjord, an arm of Sognefjord, the area today is protected by UNESCO’s World Heritage List.

comment.author: 34275825@N05
comment._content: The current hotel is the fourth hotel to be built at Stalheim. the first was built 1885 and the three hotels preceeding the current one were all destroyed by fire.

comment.author: 34302166@N04
comment._content: As Harald says; This is not a part of Hardangerfjord. The road between Voss and Stalheim continues down the Naeroydalen valley and ends in Gudvangen. This is where Naeroyfjord starts (UNESCO World Heritage). Naeroyfjord is a branch of the longest fjord in Norway, Sognefjord (204 km long). Check out www.naeroyfjord.com

comment._content: History and pics of Stalheim Hotel www.fotovoss.com/images/stalheim_hotell.htm

comment.author: 50801480@N00
comment._content: Apart from the historical value, it's a beautiful landscape picture.

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: Stalheim Hotel – Then and Now (100+ years later) As christenm.heiberg commented, these are views of the 1st and 4th hotels on this site. The first hotel, built in 1885, initially had ten guest rooms, however wings and refurbishments rapidly extended the size of the original hotel. It was destroyed by fire in 1900. Immediately rebuilt, the second hotel burnt down in 1902.   In 1906, Meinhardt's Hotel in Voss was bought, dismantled and moved to Stalheim. Sadly, it was lost to fire in 1959, along with loss of life. The current hotel, built in 1960, has 124 guest rooms. [1] [2] [3]   "Stalheim Hotel (2008)"       by Don Murphy1       "Stalheim Hotel (c. 1900)"       by Detroit Pub.
